Les points que vous avez entrez sont :
P_0= ( 8.0000000000000000E+000,  3.0000000000000000E+000)
P_1= ( 8.1000000000000000E+001,  3.5000000000000000E+000)
P_2= ( 8.6000000000000000E+001,  9.4000000000000000E+001)
P_3= ( 1.0200000000000000E+002,  4.0000000000000000E+000)

La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 1 au point 2 est : 
S1(X)=  0.00000000000000000000E+0000*( 8.1000000000000000E+001-X)^3 +  1.84384218298096488168E-0003*(X- 8.0000000000000000E+000)^3 +  4.10958904109589041085E-0002*( 8.1000000000000000E+001-X) + -9.77788978762610979951E+0000*(X- 8.0000000000000000E+000) 
La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 2 au point 3 est : 
S2(X)=  2.69200958715220872722E-0002*( 8.6000000000000000E+001-X)^3 + -1.16180963794228819808E-0001*(X- 8.1000000000000000E+001)^3 +  2.69976032119478181917E-0002*( 8.6000000000000000E+001-X) +  2.17045240948557204945E+0001*(X- 8.1000000000000000E+001) 
La fonction spline cubique reliant le point 3 au point 4 est : 
S3(X)= -3.63065511856965061899E-0002*( 1.0200000000000000E+002-X)^3 +  0.00000000000000000000E+0000*(X- 8.6000000000000000E+001)^3 +  1.51694771035383055846E+0001*( 1.0200000000000000E+002-X) +  2.50000000000000000000E-0001*(X- 8.6000000000000000E+001) 

Pour afficher ces fonctions splines sur un intervalle plus appropri√© dans Geogebra :
fonction[S1(x), 8.0000000000000000E+000, 8.1000000000000000E+001]
fonction[S2(x), 8.1000000000000000E+001, 8.6000000000000000E+001]
fonction[S3(x), 8.6000000000000000E+001, 1.0200000000000000E+002]
